moves.1. d4: D4 as per usual, let's see where it takes us.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 g6 3. Bf4 Bg7 4. Nbd2 Nc6: Black stops the bishop to B5, I just carry on with my London plan
moves.6. c3 Nf6 7. h3: Preparing an escape square for the bishop
moves.7... O-O: I think bishop to f5 is better here
moves.8. Bd3 Re8: Black want to push the e pawn
moves.9. Qc2 b5: Decision time, I am tempted to castle long but black is well positioned for a pawn storm, so a little caution
moves.11. Bg5 f6: I am tempted to take the pawn
moves.12. Bh4 f5 13. Nb3: Now to switch play, black has opened up his Kingside and his pieces are passive
moves.13... Nf6 14. Nc5 Ne4 15. Bxe4 dxe4: black further exposes his king and the e6 square is going to be important
moves.16. Qb3+ Kh8 17. Ng5: White is threatening mate, so r-f1 is forced
moves.17... Na5: Black has missed it the queen sac is on, i am really pleased with this finish as i've seen it several times but never in one of my own games :)
